result.execSummary:
The defendant Minerva Villanueva was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber for work - not child care. Court STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a    period of 15 months.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) do not use or possess alcohol or illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) AODA, treatment or program; 6) absolute sobriety; 7) no contact with victim drectly or indirectly; 8) continue counseling with Walker's Point Community Clinci until released in writting; 9) SERVE 14 DAYS at the House of Correction commecning by noon on 4-6-15 with work release for work and child care.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges.

timeConds.notes: With huber work release, commencing 4-6-15 by noon,  release for child care.

charges.descr: Sex with Child Age 16 or Older

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Minerva Villanueva

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Minerva Villanueva in court with attorney John L. Sesini.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.   State advises the Court they have complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel, Irene R. and defendant.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 9 months at the House of Correction with Huber for work - not child care.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 15 months.

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) do not use or possess alcohol or illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) AODA, treatment or program; 6) absolute sobriety; 7) no contact with victim drectly or indirectly; 8) continue counseling with Walker's Point Community Clinci until released in writting; 9) SERVE 14 DAYS at the House of Correction commecning by noon on 4-6-15 with work release for work and child care.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance, alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Defendant Minerva Villanueva in court with attorney John L. Sesini.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

On motion of the State, Court amended the Information in paragraph 3, line 3 to read ". . .had not attained the age of 18 years,. . ."

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Restitution will be addressed at that time.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Minerva Villanueva in court with attorney John L. Sesini.  Christopher Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea hearing scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (1-9-2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Irene R. or A.R.

Defendant Minerva Villanueva in court with attorney Benjamin M. Crouse.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 44.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/8/15 @ 1:30pm
